about-caustics.title: About Caustics
about-caustics.content:
Thanks for your interest in Water Caustics for URP!
You have already downloaded Water Caustics for URP and want to get started? Read the Getting Started section.
You can get Linework from the asset store here
assetstore.unity.com/packages/vfx/shaders/water-caustics-for-urp-221106

Discord: discord.gg/cFfQGzQdPn
Getting Started | Troubleshooting and Known Limitations

getting-started.title: Getting Started
getting-started.content:
How to get started using Water Caustics for URP.
Before using Water Caustics for URP, review the following important notes.


                  
                  License Agreement 
                  
                

The source code included with this asset can be freely modified to suit your needs. However, please adhere to the following restrictions:

Do not upload the source code to any public repository (e.g., GitHub). You may omit the files or keep the repository private.
Do not use any part of this source code in new publications on the Asset Store.
Do not resell the source code, either in full or in part, except as an integrated component of your game.

Redistribution of Water Caustics for URP is not allowed. If you obtained a copy through other channels than the Asset Store, please respect my work of developing/maintaining Water Caustics for URP by purchasing a legitimate copy from the Asset Store.
assetstore.unity.com/packages/vfx/shaders/water-caustics-for-urp-221106


Installation
Let’s get started.


                  
                  Compatibility 
                  
                

Before installing, carefully review the Compatibility section to verify that Linework will work with your project.


After importing the asset into Unity, you will be greeted by the support window. In the Configure tab, click on the Detect button. This will verify that everything is set up correctly in your project. If the support window does not open, you can open it by clicking Window > Linework > About and Support.

If the result is showing only green checkmarks, you are good to go! If not, see the Troubleshooting and Known Limitations section or Contact me.
Adding Outlines and Fills
To get started, open the Universal Renderer Data asset, click on Add Renderer Feature and select the outline/fill effect that you would like to add. Each outline effect stores its settings in a separate object that you can create somewhere in your Assets folder, by right-clicking and selecting Create > Linework > Outline Settings.

Drag the created settings into the object slot of the renderer feature. You can now click the Open button to open the settings.

By default, the outline should be applied to the whole scene.
Depending on which outline/fill effect you are using, you can find more detailed information about the different configuration options here.

Fast Outline
Soft Outline
Wide Outline
Edge Detection
Surface Fill

how-to-guides/caustics-volume.title: Caustics Volume
how-to-guides/caustics-volume.content:
How to place caustics.
Caustics may be positioned using caustics volumes. These volumes are cubes that may be translated, rotated and scaled. Caustics will show up wherever the volume intersects with existing scene geometry.
To help you, the caustics volume shows debug lines of the wireframe of the volume. The lines are shown in white where they intersect with existing scene geometry.

The debug view may be hidden using the Display Debug Overlay toggle in the script inspector.

how-to-guides/shader-properties.title: Shader Properties
how-to-guides/shader-properties.content:
How to use this asset.
This asset comes with a nice and clean material editor to edit the properties of the caustics. This editor will simply show up in the material section in the inspector if you have the caustics volume selected.
Texture
You can specify which caustics texture is used and at what scale it is displayed. You can also control the movement speed of the caustics.

Visuals
Here you can control the visuals of the caustics. There is a slider to control the intensity of the effect. The chromatic aberration slider controls how much the caustics appear to fall out into the RGB color channels. This is to mimic the light rays refracting through the water surface at different angles depending on the wavelength.

Light influence
The caustics may be influenced by the light in the scene. The luminance mask will mask out the caustics based on the scene luminance. This is to keep the caustics from showing up in shadowed areas.

Edge fading
The caustics will be shown within the caustics volume. To soften the edges of the caustics effect, you can fade them out towards the edges.

support/changelog.title: Changelog
support/changelog.content:
All notable changes to this package will be documented in this file.
The format is based on Keep a Changelog, and this project adheres to Semantic Versioning.
[Unreleased]
Fixed

fixed warning message on asset import about incorrect package name

[1.0.0] - 2023-08-25
The initial version of Linework.
Added

Added the Fast Outline effect for rendering simple outlines using vertex extrusion
Added the Soft Outline effect for rendering soft and glowy outlines
Added the Wide Outline effect for rendering consistent and smooth outlines
Added the Edge Detection effect for rendering a full-screen outline effect that applies to the whole scene
Added the Surface Fill effect for rendering screen-space fill effects and patterns

support/compatibility.title: Compatibility
support/compatibility.content:
Check if Linework will work in your project.


                  
                  Compatibility 
                  
                

Linework is compatible with Unity 6 and the Universal Render Pipeline. Other combinations are not supported.
In Unity 6, make sure that Compatibility Mode (Render Graph Disabled) is NOT CHECKED since this asset relies on the Render Graph API. The Compatibility Mode is disabled by default on new Unity 6 projects but may be enabled if you upgrade to Unity 6. Support for both modes will be added soon.


Unity Versions




















Unity VersionURP VersionStatus617.0.0✅ supported2022 and olderx.y.z❌ not supported
Render Pipelines





























PipelineStatusBuilt-In (legacy)❌ not supportedLight-Weight (deprecated)❌ not supportedUniversal (URP)✅ supportedHigh-Definition (HDRP)❌ not supportedCustom❌ not supported
Platforms





































































PlatformStatusWindows✅ supportedmacOS✅ supportedLinux❔ not testedWebGL 1.0❔ not testedWebGL 2.0❔ not testedAndroid❔ not testediOS❔ not testedPlaystation 5❔ not testedXbox Series X❔ not testedNintendo Switch❔ not testedPlaystation 4❔ not testedXbox One X❔ not testedOculus Quest❔ not testedDesktop VR❔ not testedApple Vision Pro❔ not tested
Graphics APIs

































Graphics APIStatusOpenGLCore❌ not supportedOpenGLES3❔ not testedVulkan✅ supportedDirect3D11✅ supportedDirect3D12❔ not testedMetal✅ supported
Other





















BatchingStatusSRP Batcher✅ supportedStatic Batching❌ not supportedGPU Instancing❌ not supported





















Rendering PathStatusForward✅ supportedForward +❔ not testedDeferred❔ not tested

















Color SpaceStatusLinear✅ supportedGamma❔ not tested
Other Assets
Linework should not run in any issues with other assets. If you encounter any issues, please see the Contact section to get in touch.

support/troubleshooting-and-known-limita.title: Troubleshooting and Known Limitations
support/troubleshooting-and-known-limita.content:
Some frequently encountered issues and how to resolve them.
Can’t find a solution to your issue here? Contact me.
Known Limitations (fixes in progress)


                  
                  Soft/Wide Outline + MSAA 
                  
                

Having Anti Aliasing (MSAA) enabled in the Universal Render Pipeline Asset will result in an error and the outlines will not render.
This will be fixed in a future update.





                  
                  Alpha cutout 
                  
                

Alpha cutout is not currently supported but support will be added soon. See the Roadmap.




                  
                  VR support 
                  
                

VR is not currently supported but support will be added soon. See the Roadmap.




                  
                  Sprite support 
                  
                

Sprites are not currently supported but support will be added soon. See the Roadmap.


Known Limitations (by design)


                  
                  Temporal Anti-aliasing (TAA) 
                  
                

If the outline is set to render After Post Processing, the outline will jitter more than the rest of the scene.




                  
                  Volume System 
                  
                

This asset has not been designed to work together with the URP Volume System.




                  
                  Deferred Rendering 
                  
                

Linework is not known to be compatible with the deferred rendering mode.




                  
                  DOTS Renderer 
                  
                

Linework is not known to be compatible with the DOTS renderer.




                  
                  Particles and transparent objects 
                  
                

Adding outlines to particles or other transparent objects is not supported.


Compatibility
See Compatibility for more information.
General


                  
                  Outline/fill does not behave as expected 
                  
                

When combining multiple types of outline effects or fills, it could sometimes be that their stencil masks interact with each other. Enable the Force Clear Stencil toggle in the settings to see if this resolves the issue. If you encounter an issue like this, please Contact me since I treat it as a bug.




                  
                  Outline/fill has influence on other rendering effects 
                  
                

Please Contact me.


Fast Outline
See Fast Outline for more information.
Soft Outline
See Soft Outline for more information.
Wide Outline
See Wide Outline for more information.
Edge Detection
See Edge Detection for more information.
Surface Fill
See Surface Fill for more information.

index.title: About Linework
index.content:
Thanks for your interest in Linework!
If you have already installed Linework and you want to get started? Read the Getting Started section.


                  
                  Linework for Unity - A Practical Toolkit for Rendering Outlines 
                  
                

With Linework you can render high-quality outlines in Unity. Multiple techniques can be used, balancing visual quality and performance. Both full-screen outlines (for outlined art-styles) as per-object outlines are supported. You can also combine outlines with fill effects such as patterns and overlays. The toolkit is designed to be feature-rich and straightforward to use.


You can get Linework from the asset store here
assetstore.unity.com/packages/slug/294140.

Useful Links
Asset Store: assetstore.unity.com/packages/slug/294140
Discord: discord.gg/cFfQGzQdPn
Getting Started Common Questions Roadmap Troubleshooting and Known Limitations
